Drachemy is a Open Source project under the License GPLv3. You can go to the git repository by clicking on the icon.
Drachemy is inspired by Alchemy : a drawing desktop application. You can visit their website by clicking on their icon.
Drawchemy possess its own Tumblr. Click on the icon to visit.
Enter in zoom/pan mode. Click again to exit this mode or click on another icon.
Reset the scale and the position of the canvas.
Display the settings of the current brush.
Enter in vertical reflection mode. All your shape will be reflected vertically. Click again to exit this mode. There is also a horizontal reflection mode.
You are in the mono-color mode. Only the main color is used. Click on the icon to enter in gradient mode.
You are in the gradient mode.The main and the secondary color are used to paint your lines and shapes with a linear gradient. Click on the icon to go back to the mono-color mode.
You are in the stroke mode where you can draw lines. Click on the icon to enter in fill mode.
You are in the fill mode where you can draw filled shapes. Click on the icon to go back to the stroke mode.
Load a image from your device and use it as background. The image is automatically scaled and rotated to fit your canvas for the best. Your previous work is completely erased.

The two circles next to the Logo are the colors, the biggest is the main color, the smallest the secondary. If you click on the secondary color, this color become the main one. If you click on the main color, the color settings appear. You can access to the color settings in the menu. These settings allow you to change the main color and activate the hue noise. The hue noise will change randomly the hue of your lines and shapes. The intensity of the noise is settable by the slidebar bellow the hue noise checkbox.
